channel.title: NYT > Movies
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 The New York Times Company

item.title: ‘Wicked: For Good’ Review: Two Besties Till the End
item.description: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande return to Oz for the second part of Jon M. Chu’s maximalist adaptation of the Broadway musical.
item.dc:creator: Manohla Dargis

item.title: ‘The Age of Disclosure,’ Documentary About U.F.O.s, Gets a Congressional Audience
item.description: “The Age of Disclosure,” a documentary featuring government and military officials, was screened for a bipartisan group of members of the House of Representatives.
item.dc:creator: Ralph Blumenthal and Leslie Kean
item.media:credit: Justin T. Gellerson for The New York Times
item.media:description: The director Dan Farah at a showing of his film, “The Age of Disclosure,” in Washington.

item.title: ‘Train Dreams’ Review: Life, Understood in Reverse
item.description: Joel Edgerton stars in a gorgeous film based on Denis Johnson’s celebrated novella about a laborer in the Pacific Northwest.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson

item.title: ‘Rental Family’ Review: Brendan Fraser, Lost in Impersonation
item.description: Brendan Fraser is quietly endearing in this fish-out-of-water tale of an American actor in Tokyo who accepts some highly unusual assignments.
item.dc:creator: Jeannette Catsoulis

item.title: ‘The Family Plan 2’ Review: A Relaxing Vacation? Maybe Not.
item.description: Mark Wahlberg and Michelle Monaghan return in a better executed, equally goofball sequel about a family’s tangles with organized crime.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Kennedy

item.title: ‘Sisu: Road to Revenge’ Review: Slapstick Rambo
item.description: In this sequel to the 2023 exploitation film, blood-splattered inanity becomes a delirium of popcorn fun.
item.dc:creator: Brandon Yu

item.title: George Clooney, Adam Sandler and Noah Baumbach on Fame and ‘Jay Kelly’
item.description: The stars and the director look back on their days trying to break into the industry and how failure was part of the equation.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan and Chantal Anderson
item.media:credit: Chantal Anderson for The New York Times
item.media:description: Noah Baumbach with Sandler and Clooney in Beverly Hills.

item.title: A.I. Video Is Threatening Our Ability to Trust Documentaries
item.description: A combination of technological developments and market forces is undermining the trust between viewer and filmmaker. What’s at stake is history itself.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson

item.title: How Much Sex, Drugs and Violence Can Be in a PG-13 Movie?
item.description: The movie ratings board has pulled back the curtain on how it approaches hot-button topics, including nudity, marijuana and guns.
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacobs

item.title: Netflix Has a New House in the Suburbs: Come In and Chill
item.description: After a string of successful events and activities, the streamer has opened its first permanent home for branded fun, at a mall near Philadelphia.
item.dc:creator: Alexis Soloski and Michelle Gustafson
item.category: Netflix House Philadelphia (King of Prussia, Pa)
item.media:credit: Michelle Gustafson for The New York Times

item.title: ‘Stop the Insanity: Finding Susan Powter’ Review: When Fame Recedes
item.description: A documentary tracks the highs and lows of the 1990s fitness guru, now a food delivery driver in Las Vegas.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Kenny
item.category: Stop the Insanity: Finding Susan Powter (Movie)

item.title: ‘Cutting Through Rocks’ Review: The Only Way Out
item.description: A documentary about Sara Shahverdi, the first woman elected to the council of her village in Iran, is propelled by her no-nonsense resourcefulness.
item.dc:creator: Sheri Linden

item.title: ‘The Age of Disclosure’ Review: Release the Extraterrestrial Files
item.description: A documentary argues that the U.S. government needs to divulge what it knows about the phenomena formerly called U.F.O.s.
item.dc:creator: Ben Kenigsberg

item.title: ‘Cactus Pears’ Review: Finding Intimacy Amid Grief
item.description: This understated Indian drama follows closeted gay man gingerly initiating a romance with an old friend.
item.dc:creator: Natalia Winkelman

item.title: ‘Sacramento,’ ‘Happy Christmas’ and More Streaming Gems
item.description: This month’s off-the-radar streaming suggestions include modest but moving indie comedy-dramas, documentaries profiling comedy legends and more.
item.dc:creator: Jason Bailey
item.category: The One and Only Dick Gregory (Movie)

item.title: ‘This World of Tomorrow’ Review: Tom Hanks Is Back in Town
item.description: The movie star plays a man from the future at the 1939 New York World’s Fair in an adaptation of some of his stories. Kelli O’Hara shines as his love interest.
item.dc:creator: Laura Collins-Hughes
item.media:description: Tom Hanks, Kayli Carter and Kelli O’Hara in “This World of Tomorrow” at the Shed in Manhattan.

item.title: Artists Pick Their Favorite Films About Artists
item.description: Movies with artist-protagonists are known to be disappointing. These pass muster and even inspire.
item.dc:creator: Julia Halperin

item.title: ‘Selena y Los Dinos’ Review: Still Dreaming of You
item.description: In this look back at the singer Selena, the director Isabel Castro presents home video footage and photographs that have not been seen in other documentaries.
item.dc:creator: Chris Azzopardi

item.title: Vanity Fair’s New Hollywood Issue, First Under New Editor, Is All About Men
item.description: Mark Guiducci gave his first issue of Vanity Fair over to the guys.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Tom Cruise Accepts an Honorary Oscar at the Governors Awards
item.description: The star was feted along with Debbie Allen, Dolly Parton and the production designer Wynn Thomas at a show that has become an awards campaign stop.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan
item.media:description: Tom Cruise with his trophy for the evening.

item.title: Has This Director Made the Year’s Most Terrifying Movie?
item.description: With the existential action thriller “Sirat,” set in the rave culture of Morocco, Oliver Laxe says that he was not out to shock, but that he is still haunted by one scene.
item.dc:creator: Ben Kenigsberg
item.media:credit: Maxime La for The New York Times
item.media:description: The question isn’t why someone dies, said Oliver Laxe, director of “Sirat.” “It’s, How do you die?” he said, adding, “Can you imagine your death dancing?”

item.title: Homayoun Ershadi, 78, Dies; ‘Kite Runner’ and ‘Taste of Cherry’ Star
item.description: He was an architect with no training as an actor whose life was changed by a chance encounter. He inspired rave reviews and a New Yorker short story.
item.dc:creator: Alex Traub

item.title: ‘Now You See Me: Now You Don’t’ Has Tricks Up Its Sleeve
item.description: The magician heist thriller franchise is back for a third installment. We go beyond the illusion to find out why these movies endure.
item.dc:creator: Alexis Soloski
item.category: Now You See Me: Now You Don't (Movie)

item.title: Leslie Odom Jr., Back in the Room Where It Happens
item.description: In “Hamilton,” no moment captures the actor’s emotional expansiveness, artistic breadth and vocal depth better than this number.
item.dc:creator: Salamishah Tillet
item.media:credit: Elias Williams for The New York Times
item.media:description: “Ten years ago, the performance was powered by rage,” said Leslie Odom Jr., whose limited run in “Hamilton” has brought a high demand for tickets. “I’m powered by love now.”

item.title: SAG Awards Changes Its Name to the Actor Awards
item.description: The annual awards, started three decades ago by the Hollywood union SAG-AFTRA, has begun to reach a global audience through livestreaming on Netflix.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor
item.media:description: The change will align the show’s name with the name of the statuette that winners receive, which has long been known as the Actor.

item.title: For ‘The Running Man,’ Colman Domingo Is Your Host
item.description: While the Emmy-winning, Oscar-nominated actor loves to put on a show, his role as Bobby T in this Stephen King adaptation is the first time he has played a showman in the movies.
item.dc:creator: Erik Piepenburg and Jason Nocito
item.media:credit: Jason Nocito for The New York Times

item.title: ‘Nouvelle Vague’: All the References Explained
item.description: The Netflix film about the making of Jean-Luc Godard’s French New Wave classic “Breathless” is chock-full of names with key roles in cinema history.
item.dc:creator: Ben Kenigsberg

item.title: Elizabeth Franz, Versatile Tony-Winning Actress, Is Dead at 84
item.description: She won the award for her performance as Linda Loman in a 1999 Broadway revival of “Death of a Salesman” and played the matriarch Kate Jerome in two Neil Simon comedies.
item.dc:creator: Richard Sandomir
item.category: Sister Mary Ignatius Explains It All for You (Play)

item.title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
item.description: In this month’s picks, parents and children in India, Germany, Korea, Italy and Sudan grapple with the joys and perils of familial bonds.
item.dc:creator: Devika Girish

item.title: Eddie Murphy Addresses ‘S.N.L.’ Feud in “Being Eddie” Documentary
item.description: The comedian’s long-running feud with the late-night sketch show is a topic in the new Netflix documentary “Being Eddie.”
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Abrams

item.title: 11 New Movies Our Critics Are Talking About This Week
item.description: Whether you’re a casual moviegoer or an avid buff, our reviewers think these films are worth knowing about.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.category: Now You See Me: Now You Don't (Movie)

item.title: Today’s Top Directors Have Some Issues With Gen Z
item.description: “Eddington,” “One Battle After Another” and “After the Hunt” focus on young characters navigating the current political climate. The depictions aren’t always flattering.
item.dc:creator: Maya Phillips

item.title: In Death, Poet Andrea Gibson Gets a Film That Celebrates Life
item.description: “Come See Me in the Good Light” follows the writer and their wife as they experienced the pain of cancer and also the joy of living.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Sperling
item.category: Come See Me in the Good Light (Movie)

item.title: Why Hollywood’s Star-Studded Movies Are Failing at the Box Office
item.description: It has been a brutal three months for dramas and comedies.
item.dc:creator: Brooks Barnes
item.media:credit: Yannis Drakoulidis/Amazon Content Services; Roadside Attractions; Kimberly French/Mubi, via Associated Press; Black Bear

item.title: ‘Come See Me in the Good Light’: The Sweetness After a Terminal Diagnosis
item.description: The film chronicles the poet Andrea Gibson’s final year of living with cancer and trying to make every second count.
item.dc:creator: Alissa Wilkinson

item.title: ‘A Very Jonas Christmas Movie’ Review: O Come, All Ye Faithful
item.description: In their fan-oriented and self-mocking holiday comedy, the millennial boy band delivers pure festive sugar rush.
item.dc:creator: Chris Azzopardi
